sub_title: Evaluator at Resultante | Measuring and Using Results
summary: You intervene. You make impact. Or you would like to. Or to do it better. I work on getting insight in effects of interventions and using these. Strong combination of beta and alpha backgrounds. Experience in different settings (corporate, non-profit, national government, UN, municipalities, foundations, education, church, missions), Dutch and international. Personal interests in development processes: partnership, intercultural relations, ethics and integrity, sustainability, long term impact, empowerment and dependency, power relations, logic models, causality and evidence, theology, missions and hospitality.

treasury_media.title: Tracking Networks of Young and Creative Organisations
treasury_media.description: Toolkit with a series of participatory exercises to assess the emergence of networks and the effects of interactions between organisations. With user experiences and examples of analysis.

education.field_of_study: International Development - specialization in Global Civilization

projects.title: Theory Based Evaluation SOS Children's Villages
projects.description: External evaluation of the Family Support Programmes in Kenya, Ghana and Nigeria, run by SOS Children's Villages. Innovative evaluation approach by applying theory based evaluation, which provided some very interesting insights about the mechanisms that trigger change at community level.

projects.title: Participatory Assessment of Development (PADev)
projects.description: Developing a methodology for impact assessment, not based on a specific intervention chain, but on a community and all changes that happened and all actors and interventions who are and were present.

projects.title: Joint Evaluation of Dutch NGOs (MFS)
projects.description:
19 alliances of Dutch NGOs evaluate their programs jointly. Together with others I was part of the design and negotiation phase; now part of the Internal Reference Group (coordinator from May-Oct 2012).

Design of website to make 200+ reports accessible.

And a little book with main lessons: Room for development. Hardcopy in Dutch, pdf in English
